conbody.p: Component landscape view displays the component artifacts in a tree structure with T24 products as root nodes. Each product node has all it's components as it's children nodes. Each component node in turn has three fixed nodes for Tables, Batches and Sources under it. The tables which belongs to the component are attached to the Tables node and the Batch processes which belongs to the component are attached to the Batch node and then the Sources which belongs to the component are attached to the Sources node.

This view helps in navigating to a particular product, component and a table or batch process or source under a component effortlessly. An pop up action (upon right-click of an item) is available which provides dialogs to capture the documents from the users.

For better assistance about the subroutine opened in source editor, you can see which component holds that subroutine,what product having that component and what are all the other components lying under that product, what are all tables, batches and sources belonging to that component, with current accessed source highlighted(see second image).

Component landscape view has a toggle button for filtering the view as component specific, presented right top corner of the view. If this button is in on state, the landscape view act as component specific else it is normal(see second image). Please note that by default this toggle button is in on state.
